Bytelandian children have developed a new game out of strings.They sum up the elements of the strings one by one and divide them by the length of the string and change them to equivalent ASCII  characters.


Input
The first line will consist of the total number of test cases T(1<=T<=10).
The next line will contain the input strings. 

Output
For each test case, output a single line which returns the corresponding code.


Example
Input:
5
AHTW
WENWS
adfdaa
AEMFE
EJF
Output:
M
P
b
F
G
